rule.assert: (1.1) An image element should have some descriptive text: an alt or longdesc attribute.
(1.1) An input element should have some descriptive text: an alt or longdesc attribute.
(1.1) An applet element should have some descriptive text: an alt or longdesc attribute.

assert.test: area/@alt or a or A or AREA/@ALT

rule.assert: (1.1) A map element should have some descriptive text: an alt attribute or a link.
(1.1) An object element should contain some descriptive text.
(1.1) A frame element should have some descriptive text: a longdesc attribute.

rule.report: (2.2) The background color and the foreground color are the same
(3.3) Concerning element : B and I are not recommended. Use strong and em, or stylesheets.

rule.assert: (3.3) A list should not be used for formatting effects
(4.3) The primary language of a document should be identified.
(5.1) A table should have a caption
(5.5) A table should have a summary attribute
(5.2) Table data should identify its scope, headers, axis in attributes.
(5.6) A table header should have an abbr attribute to give abbreviation
(6.4) If you specify an "onmouseup" attribute on a element, you should also specify an "onkeyup" attribute
(6.4) If you specify an "onmousedown" attribute on a element, you should also specify an "onkeydown" attribute
(6.4) If you specify an "onclick" event on a element, you should also specify an "onkeypress"
(6.5) The marquee element is not good HTML
(6.5) The blink element is not good HTML
